section.title: Simple Portable SQL Query:
section.description: Assuming that you are connected to the Airports SQL Server database, which has a Location field of type Geography:
section.example: SELECT id, Code, Name, City, County, State, GeogLatitude(Location) AS Lat, GeogLongitude(Location) AS Lon( Elevation FROM US_Airports

section.title: Use of SQL::ResultSet::DataAsGeography
section.example:
dim Result as C dim cn as sql::Connection dim Geography as A ' Note that weï¿½ve dimmed this as A to show the true type.
if cn.open(ConnectionString)
Result = Result + "Connection opened successfully." + crlf() cn.portableSQLEnabled = .t.
if cn.execute("select GeogAsText(g.Location) from GeogTest g") Result = Result + "Query executed successfully." + crlf() ResultSet = cn.ResultSet
Geography = ResultSet.DataAsGeography(1, 4326) Result = Result + "Geography object is of type: " + \ typeof(Geography) + crlf() Result = Result + "Geography as XML: " + Geography.AsGML().Value + crlf() Result = Result + "Geography object as Text: " + \ Geography.ToString() + crlf() Result = Result + "Geography Longitude: " + Geography.Long.Value + crlf() Result = Result + "Geography Latitude: " + Geography.Lat.Value + crlf(2) else Result = Result + "Error executing query: " + CurrentQuery + \ crlf() + "Result is: " + cn.callresult.text + crlf(2) end if
else Result = Result + "Error opening connection:: " \ + ConnectionString + crlf() + "Result is: " + cn.callresult.text + crlf(2) end if
showvar(Result)

section.title: An interactive session demonstrating DataAsGeography
section.description: Assuming you have run a SQL query that returns location as a Geography object in resultset rs:
section.example: dim Geography as P Geography = rs.DataAsGeography("Result is: ", 4326) ?Geography.Long.value = -84.11936 ?Geography.Lat.Value = 33.811217
